text.__SUMMARY__: Grevillea minutiflora is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to a small area in the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia.The dense many branched shrub typically grows to a height of 1 to 1.5 metres (3 to 5 ft) and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple leaves with a blade that is 25 to 60 millimetres (1.0 to 2.4 in) in length. It blooms from April to September and produces a terminal raceme irregular inflorescence with white or cream flowers. Later it forms rugose ellipsoidal or oblong glabrous fruit that is 7.5 to 8.5 mm (0.3 to 0.3 in) long.
